verses.text_plain: Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that entereth not by the door into the sheepfold, but climbeth up some other way, the same is a thief and a robber.
verses.verse_html: 1Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that entereth not by the door into the sheepfold, but climbeth up some other way, the same is a thief and a robber.

verses.text_plain: But he that entereth in by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.
verses.verse_html: 2But he that entereth in by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.

verses.text_plain: To him the porter openeth; and the sheep hear his voice: and he calleth his own sheep by name, and leadeth them out.
verses.verse_html: 3To him the porter openeth; and the sheep hear his voice: and he calleth his own sheep by name, and leadeth them out.

verses.text_plain: And when he putteth forth his own sheep, he goeth before them, and the sheep follow him: for they know his voice.
verses.verse_html: 4And when he putteth forth his own sheep, he goeth before them, and the sheep follow him: for they know his voice.

verses.text_plain: And a stranger will they not follow, but will flee from him: for they know not the voice of strangers.
verses.verse_html: 5And a stranger will they not follow, but will flee from him: for they know not the voice of strangers.

verses.text_plain: This parable spake Jesus unto them: but they understood not what things they were which he spake unto them.
verses.verse_html: 6This parable spake Jesus unto them: but they understood not what things they were which he spake unto them.

verses.text_plain: Then said Jesus unto them again, Verily, verily, I say unto you, I am the door of the sheep.
verses.verse_html: 7Then said Jesus unto them again, Verily, verily, I say unto you, I am the door of the sheep.

verses.text_plain: All that ever came before me are thieves and robbers: but the sheep did not hear them.
verses.verse_html: 8All that ever came before me are thieves and robbers: but the sheep did not hear them.

verses.text_plain: I am the door: by me if any man enter in, he shall be saved, and shall go in and out, and find pasture.
verses.verse_html: 9I am the door: by me if any man enter in, he shall be saved, and shall go in and out, and find pasture.

verses.text_plain: The thief cometh not, but for to steal, and to kill, and to destroy: I am come that they might have life, and that they might have it more abundantly.
verses.verse_html: 10The thief cometh not, but for to steal, and to kill, and to destroy: I am come that they might have life, and that they might have it more abundantly.

verses.text_plain: I am the good shepherd: the good shepherd giveth his life for the sheep.
verses.verse_html: 11I am the good shepherd: the good shepherd giveth his life for the sheep.

verses.text_plain: But he that is an hireling, and not the shepherd, whose own the sheep are not, seeth the wolf coming, and leaveth the sheep, and fleeth: and the wolf catcheth them, and scattereth the sheep.
verses.verse_html: 12But he that is an hireling, and not the shepherd, whose own the sheep are not, seeth the wolf coming, and leaveth the sheep, and fleeth: and the wolf catcheth them, and scattereth the sheep.

verses.text_plain: The hireling fleeth, because he is an hireling, and careth not for the sheep.
verses.verse_html: 13The hireling fleeth, because he is an hireling, and careth not for the sheep.

verses.text_plain: I am the good shepherd, and know my sheep, and am known of mine.
verses.verse_html: 14I am the good shepherd, and know my sheep, and am known of mine.

verses.text_plain: As the Father knoweth me, even so know I the Father: and I lay down my life for the sheep.
verses.verse_html: 15As the Father knoweth me, even so know I the Father: and I lay down my life for the sheep.

verses.text_plain: And other sheep I have, which are not of this fold: them also I must bring, and they shall hear my voice; and there shall be one fold, and one shepherd.
verses.verse_html: 16And other sheep I have, which are not of this fold: them also I must bring, and they shall hear my voice; and there shall be one fold, and one shepherd.

verses.text_plain: Therefore doth my Father love me, because I lay down my life, that I might take it again.
verses.verse_html: 17Therefore doth my Father love me, because I lay down my life, that I might take it again.

verses.text_plain: No man taketh it from me, but I lay it down of myself. I have power to lay it down, and I have power to take it again. This commandment have I received of my Father.
verses.verse_html: 18No man taketh it from me, but I lay it down of myself. I have power to lay it down, and I have power to take it again. This commandment have I received of my Father.

verses.text_plain: There was a division therefore again among the Jews for these sayings.
verses.verse_html: 19There was a division therefore again among the Jews for these sayings.

verses.text_plain: And many of them said, He hath a devil, and is mad; why hear ye him?
verses.verse_html: 20And many of them said, He hath a devil, and is mad; why hear ye him?

verses.text_plain: Others said, These are not the words of him that hath a devil. Can a devil open the eyes of the blind?
verses.verse_html: 21Others said, These are not the words of him that hath a devil. Can a devil open the eyes of the blind?

tokens.text: of him that hath a devil

verses.text_plain: And it was at Jerusalem the feast of the dedication, and it was winter.
verses.verse_html: 22And it was at Jerusalem the feast of the dedication, and it was winter.

verses.text_plain: And Jesus walked in the temple in Solomon’s porch.
verses.verse_html: 23And Jesus walked in the temple in Solomon’s porch.

verses.text_plain: Then came the Jews round about him, and said unto him, How long dost thou make us to doubt? If thou be the Christ, tell us plainly.
verses.verse_html: 24Then came the Jews round about him, and said unto him, How long dost thou make us to doubt? If thou be the Christ, tell us plainly.

verses.text_plain: Jesus answered them, I told you, and ye believed not: the works that I do in my Father’s name, they bear witness of me.
verses.verse_html: 25Jesus answered them, I told you, and ye believed not: the works that I do in my Father’s name, they bear witness of me.

verses.text_plain: But ye believe not, because ye are not of my sheep, as I said unto you.
verses.verse_html: 26But ye believe not, because ye are not of my sheep, as I said unto you.

verses.text_plain: My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me:
verses.verse_html: 27My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me:

verses.text_plain: And I give unto them eternal life; and they shall never perish, neither shall any man pluck them out of my hand.
verses.verse_html: 28And I give unto them eternal life; and they shall never perish, neither shall any man pluck them out of my hand.

verses.text_plain: My Father, which gave them me, is greater than all; and no man is able to pluck them out of my Father’s hand.
verses.verse_html: 29My Father, which gave them me, is greater than all; and no man is able to pluck them out of my Father’s hand.

verses.text_plain: I and my Father are one.
verses.verse_html: 30I and my Father are one.

verses.text_plain: Then the Jews took up stones again to stone him.
verses.verse_html: 31Then the Jews took up stones again to stone him.

verses.text_plain: Jesus answered them, Many good works have I shewed you from my Father; for which of those works do ye stone me?
verses.verse_html: 32Jesus answered them, Many good works have I shewed you from my Father; for which of those works do ye stone me?

verses.text_plain: The Jews answered him, saying, For a good work we stone thee not; but for blasphemy; and because that thou, being a man, makest thyself God.
verses.verse_html: 33The Jews answered him, saying, For a good work we stone thee not; but for blasphemy; and because that thou, being a man, makest thyself God.

verses.text_plain: Jesus answered them, Is it not written in your law, I said, Ye are gods?
verses.verse_html: 34Jesus answered them, Is it not written in your law, I said, Ye are gods?

verses.text_plain: If he called them gods, unto whom the word of God came, and the scripture cannot be broken;
verses.verse_html: 35If he called them gods, unto whom the word of God came, and the scripture cannot be broken;

verses.text_plain: Say ye of him, whom the Father hath sanctified, and sent into the world, Thou blasphemest; because I said, I am the Son of God?
verses.verse_html: 36Say ye of him, whom the Father hath sanctified, and sent into the world, Thou blasphemest; because I said, I am the Son of God?

verses.text_plain: If I do not the works of my Father, believe me not.
verses.verse_html: 37If I do not the works of my Father, believe me not.

verses.text_plain: But if I do, though ye believe not me, believe the works: that ye may know, and believe, that the Father is in me, and I in him.
verses.verse_html: 38But if I do, though ye believe not me, believe the works: that ye may know, and believe, that the Father is in me, and I in him.

verses.text_plain: Therefore they sought again to take him: but he escaped out of their hand,
verses.verse_html: 39Therefore they sought again to take him: but he escaped out of their hand,

verses.text_plain: And went away again beyond Jordan into the place where John at first baptized; and there he abode.
verses.verse_html: 40And went away again beyond Jordan into the place where John at first baptized; and there he abode.

verses.text_plain: And many resorted unto him, and said, John did no miracle: but all things that John spake of this man were true.
verses.verse_html: 41And many resorted unto him, and said, John did no miracle: but all things that John spake of this man were true.

verses.text_plain: And many believed on him there.
verses.verse_html: 42And many believed on him there.
